headline: In pictures: New Year welcomed around the world
first_sentence: Nations around the world are welcoming the New Year as midnight strikes across different time zones.

headline: ITV agrees to invest £3m in fitness app created by Joe Wicks
first_sentence: The broadcaster ITV has agreed to invest up to £3m into the health and fitness app The Body Coach, created by Joe Wicks, who shot to fame by getting people exercising in their living rooms during the Covid pandemic.

headline: Watch: Stunning celestial events that lit up the skies in 2025
first_sentence: From meteor showers to supermoons, many stunning celestial events have been captured on camera over the past year.

headline: Teen jockey Loughnane breaks calendar year wins record on New Year's Eve
first_sentence: Teenage jockey Billy Loughnane has broken the record for the most wins in a calendar year this century.

headline: New British passport to feature king’s coat of arms and enhanced security
first_sentence: A new British passport, claimed to be the most secure ever produced and featuring King Charles’s coat of arms on the front cover, has come into use.

headline: €1m Picasso portrait up for grabs for €100 in charity auction
first_sentence: His work is consistently ranked among the world’s most expensive art, with paintings fetching more than a $100m at auction.

headline: Swashbuckling Puss embarks on a brave quest
first_sentence: Puss must beat a host of fairy-tale characters to the magical map of the Wishing Star.

headline: Nurse 'lucky to be alive' after crowbar attack at hospital
first_sentence: A nurse has told how she was "beaten nearly to death" after a man went on a rampage with a crowbar in a Merseyside hospital building.

headline: New year revellers told to wrap up warm with snow expected across UK
first_sentence: Snowfall is expected across much of the UK in a chilly start to the new year, forecasters have said, as revellers were advised to wrap up with near-freezing temperatures expected on New Year’s Eve.

headline: 'I am so happy': Crowd celebrates Thailand's release of Cambodian soldiers
first_sentence: Thailand has released 18 Cambodian soldiers held since fighting between the two nations broke out in July.

headline: Felix hoping to start 2026 with a bang at Aus Open
first_sentence: Felix Auger-Aliassime says he can challenge at the Australian Open after winning 24 of his last 31 matches to end the year.

headline: Jair Bolsonaro undergoes second procedure to treat persistent hiccups
first_sentence: Jair Bolsonaro underwent a second “phrenic nerve block procedure” on Monday to treat persistent hiccups.

headline: Some of the best TV in years is to come
first_sentence: It looks like 2026 could give us some of the best TV in years, although with scheduling plans often only being made public weeks before transmission, it's impossible to know whether some shows will actually go on air in the coming year, or in 2027.

headline: 'I've had wonderful support from women', says incoming Archbishop of Canterbury
first_sentence: "One of the wonderful things over the last couple of months is I've had hundreds and hundreds of letters of support," says the incoming Archbishop of Canterbury.

headline: Sir David Attenborough shares his life in sound
first_sentence:
In an exclusive interview for Radio 4 David Attenborough talks to Chris Watson about his life in sound.

One of Sir David's first jobs in natural history film making was as a wildlife sound recordist.

headline: 'Are you sure?' - Guardiola questions two-horse race

headline: Living the dream - Hood plans to open Chinese with Ally Pally winnings

headline: Heated Rivalry author says TV success led to help with her Parkinson's
first_sentence: The author of Heated Rivalry has revealed the success of the TV adaptation has resulted in her receiving specialist help with her Parkinson's disease.

headline: Gold and silver see rollercoaster end to blockbuster year

headline: Watch: Underwater chess champions compete for world title
first_sentence: The Diving Chess World Championships has taken place in Groningen, Netherlands, with players using weighted pieces and magnetic boards.
